sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Filip Paldia & Jamie Clarke)
articles.description: AI promises a major upheaval in typography, with designers finding themselves navigating both opportunities and challenges. How will it impact quality, design roles, and our use of type in the future? As we explore this new frontier, we realise that we are at a juncture as significant as Gutenberg’s press, set to redefine how we interact with text and visual communication.
articles.title: The AI Dilemma In Graphic Design: Steering Towards Excellence In Typography And Beyond

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: The CSS `border-image` property is one of those properties you undoubtedly know exists but may not have ever reached for. In this article, Temani Afif demonstrates different approaches for using `border-image` to create clever decorative accents and shapes.
articles.title: The Complex But Awesome CSS border-image Property

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Louis Lazaris)
articles.description: Useful front-end tools for CSS and JavaScript developers that were most popular last year and will help you speed up your development workflow. Let’s dive in!
articles.title: Top Front-End Tools Of 2023

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Atila Fassina)
articles.description: Are you ready for a little exercise of pulling a framework apart and putting the pieces back together? In this article, Atila Fassina explains how meta-frameworks have evolved around core libraries in their own unique ways.
articles.title: SolidStart: A Different Breed Of Meta-Framework

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: The View Transitions API is a new — but game-changing — feature that allows us to do the types of reactive state-based UI and page transitions that have traditionally been exclusive to JavaScript frameworks. In the second half of this mini two-part series, Adrian Bece expands on the demos from the first article to demonstrate how the View Transitions API can be used to transition not just elements between two states but the transition between full views and pages in single-page and multi-page applications.
articles.title: The View Transitions API And Delightful UI Animations (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Let’s start into the new year with a little inspiration boost: wallpapers created with love by the community for the community. Happy 2024!
articles.title: The Magic Of New Beginnings (January 2024 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Juan Diego Rodríguez)
articles.description: JavaScript may be the most popular client-side language in the world, but it’s far from perfect and not without its quirks. Juan Diego Rodriguez examines several “absurd” JavaScript eccentricities and explains how they made it into the language as well as how to avoid them in your own code.
articles.title: Making Sense Of “Senseless” JavaScript Features

articles.author: Juan P. Romano
articles.description: In this tutorial, you'll learn how to create a simple yet funny bouncing ball game using the PyGame library.  Whether you're a beginner seeking to grasp the fundamentals of game development or an enthusiast eager to explore PyGame's capabilities, this article is your guide to crafting a simple yet
articles.title: PyGame Tutorial – How to Build a Bouncing Ball Game

articles.author: Mahmud Adeleye
articles.description: Artificial Intelligence: The New Frontier for Frontend Developers The demand for AI-powered applications is growing at a fast pace. As a front-end developer, you can take advantage of this trend and advance your career by integrating your skills in frontend development with AI technologies. This integration allows you to build
articles.title: How to Build AI Apps – A Frontend Developer's Guide

articles.author: Matt Morgan
articles.description: Event-driven architecture is a software design pattern where components or services perform actions in response to events, often asynchronously. This post serves as a companion to our video course, "Deep Dive into Event-Driven Architecture on AWS." In the course, we delve into some of the core fundamentals of event-driven architecture
articles.title: Refactoring with Event-Driven Architecture on AWS

articles.author: Joan Ayebola
articles.description: State management is a crucial aspect of building robust and scalable React applications, especially when dealing with APIs.  As your application grows in complexity, efficiently managing the state becomes essential for a smooth user experience.  In the React ecosystem, there are several options for state management, each with
articles.title: How to Manage State in React Apps with APIs – Redux, Context API, and Recoil Examples

articles.author: Isaiah Clifford Opoku
articles.description: Welcome to this in-depth guide on crafting a RESTful API with NestJS, Docker, Swagger, and Prisma. My goal here is to teach you how to build robust and efficient backends, regardless of whether you're a seasoned developer or a beginner just dipping your toes into the world of coding. In
articles.title: How to Build a CRUD REST API with NestJS, Docker, Swagger, and Prisma

articles.author: Jose Vicente Nunez
articles.description: In this short tutorial, I want to share with you a few tricks and tips to help you deal with some common situations when you're working in the Linux command line. We will cover the following:  * find  * xargs and nproc  * taskset  * numactl
articles.title: Command Line Tricks You Can Learn Faster than Drinking Your Morning Coffee

articles.author: Ijeoma Igboagu
articles.description: AI tools have become quite popular recently. Developers use these tools to help generate ideas, create simple code examples, and so on.  In 2023, ChatGPT and other Large Language Models found their way into many of our toolkits. And we can use them to be more productive and save
articles.title: AI Tools You Can Use in Visual Studio Code Besides GitHub Copilot

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: OpenAI's Assistants API is a powerful tool that allows developers to build AI assistants within their apps efficiently. It simplifies managing conversation history and provides access to advanced features like Code Interpreter and Retrieval. The API also improves function-calling for third-party tools. We just published a course on the freeCodeCamp.org
articles.title: Create AI Assistants with OpenAI's Assistants API

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Are you fascinated by both Python and the night sky? We just posted a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you how to use Python to analyze and visualize astronomical Data. This course was created by Spartificial, whose mission is to provide engineering education in the most
articles.title: Learn Data Analysis and Visualization with Python Using Astronomical Data

articles.author: Abraham Dahunsi
articles.description: Web servers are responsible for delivering web pages and various resources to clients through the internet. They can exist either as software or hardware components. But unfortunately, they often become targets for hackers and malicious individuals seeking to exploit any vulnerabilities to compromise data and disrupt functionality. As a result,
articles.title: How to Secure Your Web Server with Continuous Integration Using NGINX and CircleCI
